intro: Synaphea brachystachya, commonly known as the dwarf synaphea, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a mild, spicy scent. Synaphea brachystachya is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky outcrops.
